page.title: 11LOCAL PRESS IN MIDHURST.
page.content: The Midhurst and Petworth Observer was founded in 1882 and was the first paper to report local news.Over the last 1O years it has changed and has become brighter and more attractive with use of colour printing.It is likely to continue to change.It has also become more willing to publish controversial material that might offend some people.The paper sells about 54OO copies a week and the circulation is still rising.They estimate that they have prodoced two and a half million copies since 1975. The paper employs 2 journalists based in Midhurst. There is also an advertising representative and a sub-editor who corrects the copy and designs the pages.Altogether there are 1O employees plus the printers.The paper is part of a group and is printed at Portsmouth.
